author: AP
text: In the United States, California expands rebates for electric cars but critics say the grid needs upgrades first.

author: CarTalks Canada
text: In Canada, winter range on my EV drops a lot, but the low maintenance is worth it.

author: BBC
text: The United Kingdom delays petrol car ban, yet EV charging points are rolling out rapidly in London and Manchester.

author: DW
text: Germany boosts subsidies for home chargers as automakers ramp up electric cars made in Bavaria.

author: Paris EV Life
text: France finally added fast chargers along the A7; my road trip to Marseille in an electric car was smooth.

author: El País
text: Spain offers tax credits for electric cars, yet rural regions still lack reliable charging networks.

author: RomaDriver
text: In Italy the EV incentives are great, but parking with chargers in Rome is always full.

author: Economic Times
text: India unveils a policy to localize battery production for electric cars and reduce dependence on imports.

author: SCMP
text: China's Shenzhen expands curbside charging; domestic brands make electric cars cheaper than rivals.

author: TokyoTech
text: Japan's solid-state batteries could make electric cars lighter, but mass production is still years away.

author: ABC Australia
text: Australia sees rapid adoption of electric cars in Sydney and Melbourne as highway charging improves.

author: Folha
text: Brazil pilots biofuel-friendly policies while São Paulo tests incentives for electric cars in fleets.

author: Cape EV
text: In South Africa, loadshedding makes charging tricky, but solar + home batteries are changing the game.

author: SVT
text: Sweden expands workplace chargers; commuters say winter EV driving is fine with preconditioning.

author: The National (UAE)
text: The United Arab Emirates adds ultra-fast chargers along Abu Dhabi–Dubai, making electric cars more practical.

author: Bloomberg
text: In the United States, the SEC advances new rules for crypto exchanges, rattling traders on Wall Street.

author: CBC
text: Canada tightens stablecoin guidance while Toronto startups keep building crypto wallets.

author: CriptoMX
text: En México, muchos usan bitcoin para remesas; las comisiones son mejores que los bancos.

author: Estadão
text: Brazilian regulators explore CBDC pilots while crypto adoption grows in São Paulo and Rio.

author: La Nación
text: Argentina sees rising crypto use amid inflation; locals prefer dollar-pegged stablecoins.

author: Naija Crypto
text: In Nigeria, P2P crypto trading remains strong; people rely on it when banks restrict transfers.

author: News24
text: South Africa grants more crypto licenses; Johannesburg exchanges promise better protections.

author: Anadolu
text: Turkey's parliament drafts comprehensive crypto regulation following high-profile exchange failures.

author: Politico EU
text: Across the European Union, MiCA rules push exchanges to register and enhance consumer disclosures.

author: The Hindu
text: India's 1% TDS on crypto trades still discourages activity, but Web3 developers keep shipping.

author: Caixin
text: China accelerates digital yuan pilots while keeping tight controls on public crypto trading.

author: Tokyo DeFi
text: Japan's exchanges feel safer now; regulations increased, but liquidity for altcoins is thin.

author: Yonhap
text: South Korea demands stricter listings; Seoul retail traders remain active despite volatility.

author: The National (UAE)
text: The United Arab Emirates attracts crypto companies to Dubai's free zones with clear licensing.

author: Financial Times
text: The United Kingdom pushes for fair advertising rules on crypto to curb scams targeting retail investors.

author: NYTimes
text: In the United States, schools debate AI policy while startups in San Francisco launch new copilots.

author: Guardian
text: The United Kingdom hosts an AI safety summit as regulators consider rules for foundation models.

author: Handelsblatt
text: Germany funds AI research hubs in Munich and Berlin to support industrial automation.

author: Paris ML
text: In France, AI startups are thriving; our lab in Paris just released a bilingual model.

author: Economic Times
text: India launches an AI mission to modernize public healthcare, starting with pilot hospitals in Delhi.

author: SCMP
text: China invests in AI chip startups across Shenzhen and Shanghai to reduce reliance on imports.

author: Tokyo AI
text: Japan's robotics labs show off new humanoids; integrating AI planning is still challenging.

author: Korea Herald
text: South Korea funds AI semiconductor research in Daejeon to stay competitive globally.

author: Folha
text: Brazil explores AI for agriculture analytics as universities in São Paulo pilot field sensors.

author: Cape Data
text: In South Africa, startups use AI to detect water leaks in Cape Town; results look promising.

author: Haaretz
text: Israel's AI cybersecurity firms expand exports, citing demand from Europe and the US.

author: The National (UAE)
text: The United Arab Emirates funds Arabic-first AI models to boost regional tech leadership.

author: Premium Times
text: Nigeria invests in AI training programs in Lagos to support fintech and health startups.

author: Straits Times
text: Singapore publishes guidelines for trustworthy AI while funding compute credits for SMEs.

author: Sydney AI
text: Australia's universities push applied AI; my lab demo in Sydney showed solid results for medical imaging.
